subSections.title: Chinese
subSections.text: {{zh-forms|alt=𠜱-Cantonese; Hakka; Teochew "to pare",㓟-Cantonese and Teochew "to pare",剕-Cantonese "to pare",剖-Teochew "to pare"}}

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
; “to pare”
: {{zh-l|𠜱}} is sometimes treated as the {{zh-l|本字|original character}}.
; “pie”
: Borrowed from {{bor|yue|en|pie}}.
; “vulva; cunt”
: From the {{w|Sichuanese dialects|Sichuanese}} pronunciation of {{zh-l|屄|pi1}}.

{{etystub|zh}}

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=pī,er=y
|m_note=erhua-ed - “fibres ready to be drawn and twisted”
|m-s=pei1/pi1
|m-s_note=originally pi1, but changed to pei1 because of homophony with {{l|zh|屄}}
|c=pai1
|h=pfs=phî/phâi
|h_note=phâi - “to peel”
|md=
|mn=xm,qz,tp,kh,tn,tc,hc,lk,sx,km,mg:phoe/ml,yl:phe/tw:phi
|mn_note=Xiamen, Quanzhou: phoe - vernacular; phe - literary
mainstream Taiwan: phoe - vernacular; phi - literary
|mn-t=poi1
|mc=y
|oc=y
|cat=v,n,cls
}}
